results.title: Born to build
results.brief_description: Bodybuilding is more than just moving heavy metal. To Alex it is his life. Fascinated as a child with size and strength and an addiction to Marvel comics Alex finally starting pumping iron at the age of 16 and became hooked. Follow his journey in this humourous comic book style presentation as he lifts those weights and pumps that iron to build the perfect body.

results.title: Ode to a shoebox
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Narada Lawson
results.brief_description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.

results.title: A Family story
results.brief_description: As a small child living in London Daphne witnessed the Blitz. This story is about Daphne’s life growing up in London in WW2 and her migration and settlement in Australia.

results.title: A Writer's legacy
results.brief_description: Heather’s father believed in his daughter as a writer even when she did not believe in herself. He left her letters and memorabilia but the real legacy her father left her was the love of writing.

results.title: Camping legends
results.brief_description: In 1936 Fiona’s grandparents drove the inland route from Lithgow to Ayr in far North Queensland in a 1927 dodge. The journey was legendary.

results.title: My grandfather, the spy
results.brief_description: It was wartime when Edwina’s grandfather met her grandmother. He had a toothache and met his wife to be at the front door. Her father was the local dentist. Edwina tells her grandfather’s extraordinary life story.

results.title: Life: What a Ride
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”
results.description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” Cancer returns to my body. My breasts are gone, breasts that nurtured four children and gave pleasure. In their place a tapestry of the scars and wounds of the last 12 years.”
